nic are my triped chars stiil with tyrael

LurkerAbyss <1641coburn@...> wrote:Dracon slips into the elevator, staying silent and simply listening in on the conversation.
----- Original Message ----- 
From: Nic 
To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
Sent: Friday, June 06, 2003 11:02 PM
Subject: Re: The new Contract


Krhinos entered an elevator and signaled his two other companions to
follow him.

Krhinos: No matter. They must all have been too drunk to notice
anyways. The point is, though, that we are going on a mission and we
bring in a full mining and processing station with us. Outpost on
planet, space relay. In short, the full monty! This is one heck of a
contract!

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "Jeff" <x_rauq_x@y...> wrote:
> --Rukus--
> 
> "Lead on. Keep an eye out for tails." Rukus eyes the crowd as he 
> speaks. No bots attracted notice under his careful scrutiny, but 
> that didn't mean anything. "We weren't being descrete, so unwelcome 
> eyes may have wavered our way."
> 
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "LurkerAbyss" <1641coburn@r...> wrote:
> > Dracon made no gestures and remained blank in the face, almost to 
> the point of appearing to be sinister.
> > 
> > "If it's important...then let's go," he said, agreeing with 
> Krhinos, "we should discuss this ordeal furthermore amongst 
> ourselves..."
> >   ----- Original Message ----- 
> >   From: Nic 
> >   To: nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com 
> >   Sent: Thursday, June 05, 2003 10:26 PM
> >   Subject: Re: The new Contract
> > 
> > 
> >   Krhinos watched the lithe bot come close and sneaking past the 
> crowd.
> > 
> >   Krhinos: Rukus, right? Good then. I guess this is the whole of 
> the
> >   crew. I'd tell you more about this mission, but not in here. Too 
> many
> >   ears and I don't trust about all of them. Suffice it to say, your
> >   paycheck is sitting calmly on the mobile station and you are 
> eligible
> >   to 3.75% of the profits we make on this operation. The number 
> might
> >   seem low, but wait for the real thing! Now come along and let's 
> go
> >   somewhere more private.
> > 
> >   Ironically, he was saying this precise sentence in the precise 
> place
> >   and to the precise poeple in which circumstances it seemed 
> weird. In
> >   fact, one of the pleasure bots was saying the same thing to a 
> drunken
> >   miner who was nearly passed out on the floor. Lucky for her, the 
> guy
> >   had already paid her, twice rather than once, drunk as he was.
> >
